title: Trump Buys Himself Time, and Opens Up Some New Options
summary: While President Trump appears to be offering one more off ramp to the Iranians, he also is bolstering his own military options.

title: U.S. Spy Agencies Assess Iran Remains Undecided on Building a Bomb
summary: U.S. intelligence officials said Iran was likely to pivot toward producing a nuclear weapon if the U.S. attacked a main uranium enrichment site, or if Israel killed its supreme leader.

title: ‘Two Weeks’ Is Trump’s Favorite Unit of Time
summary: “Two weeks” is one of President Trump’s favorite units of time. It can mean something, or nothing at all.

title: Record Debt Limit Increase Would Break Republican Precedent
summary: A proposed $5 trillion debt limit increase could make it hard for Republicans to maintain their fiscal hawk credibility.

title: ‘Little Lobbyists’ Urge Senators to Oppose Trump’s Bill Cutting Medicaid
summary: Children with disabilities and their parents who rely on the health insurance program took to Capitol Hill this week to warn that the proposed reductions could be ‘devastating.’

title: U.S. v. Skrmetti: How the Transgender Rights Movement Bet on the Supreme Court and Lost
summary: The inside story of the case that could set the movement back a generation.

title: How the Supreme Court’s Transgender Ruling Reveals a Shift
summary: In its biggest ruling of the term, the Supreme Court on Wednesday upheld a Tennessee law that prohibits some medical treatments for transgender youths, shielding similar laws in more than 20 other states. Adam Liptak, who covers the Supreme Court for The New York Times, describes the three factions of justices in the 6-to-3 decision.

title: What to Know About United States v. Skrmetti
summary: A Times examination shows how a landmark case about gender-affirming care for minors was built on flawed politics and uncertain science.

title: How Black Lung Came Roaring Back to Coal Country
summary: Once nearly eradicated, the “old man’s disease” is back and suffocating younger miners. Federal cuts risk putting a solution further out of reach.

title: The World’s 50 Best Restaurants Announces Its 2025 List
summary: A Peruvian spot took No. 1, while five U.S. chefs kept places on the list.

title: Karen Read Acquittal Exposes Flaws in Police Practices, Supporters and Critics Say
summary: Both sides agreed that the investigation into the death of Ms. Read’s boyfriend, a Boston police officer, was flawed and plagued by unethical and unprofessional conduct.

title: ‘SVU’ Star Mariska Hargitay on Her Mother Jayne Mansfield
summary: In a new documentary made by the “Law & Order: SVU” star, she examines her own clouded origins and the mother she barely knew: Jayne Mansfield.

title: Cannes Lions Festival Plays Host to a Messy Business Divorce
summary: Michael Kassan, a ringmaster in the media industry, is going head to head at its top event with United Talent Agency, a company that has sued him.

title: TikTok Hits Cannes, Where a U.S. Ban Seems a Distant Dream
summary: TikTok executives hosted happy hours and played pickleball with influencers on the French Riviera this week, even as a U.S. ban loomed over the company.

title: Marijuana’s Links to Heart Attack and Stroke Are Becoming Clearer
summary: The evidence is stacking up that the drug is associated with a greater likelihood of heart problems.

title: Vera Rubin Observatory Brings Universe’s Darkest Mysteries Into Focus
summary: As the Vera C. Rubin Observatory surveys the night sky, astrophysicists expect to unlock the secrets of dark matter, dark energy and cosmic phenomena that go “bang!”

title: The Supreme Court’s Blindness to Transgender Reality
summary: The retrenchment on transgender rights is fueled by fear: fear of the future, fear of unfamiliar concepts, fear of not knowing one’s child.

title: The Progressive Regulator Winning Over the Populist Right
summary: Lina Khan wants to overthrow “the autocrats of trade.”

title: Police Investigate Threats to Mamdani in Mayoral Race’s Final Days
summary: Voice mail messages promising violence against Zohran Mamdani, a progressive Democrat, came as attacks on politicians, judges and other government officials have skyrocketed.

title: Cave Explorer Videos Show Decade of Trash in ‘Avatar’ Park in China
summary: Officials ordered a huge cleanup effort after videos of the mountains of garbage spread widely online.

title: Bear Whose Head Was Stuck for Two Years Is Freed
summary: An unwelcome plastic collar was removed from around the neck of a 2-year-old bear.

title: Boy, 15, Survives Lightning Strike in Central Park, Police Say
summary: The boy was standing under a tree when lightning hit and an electrical current transferred to a chain necklace around his neck, a law enforcement official said.
